item.title: UN expert urges states to ban evictions amid pandemic
item.description: A UN rights expert called Tuesday for governments to ban evictions until the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic ends, warning the number of people being expelled from their homes was rising globally.

item.title: Mali president and Prime Minister 'arrested' - mutiny leader
item.description: Mutineering soldiers in Mali on Tuesday detained President Ibrahim Boubacar Keita and Prime Minister Boubou Cisse, one of their leaders said.

item.title: Global COVID-19 cases almost 22M, death toll at 774,832 with more than 13.6M recoveries
item.description: At least 21,936,820 cases of coronavirus have been registered in 196 countries and territories. Of these, at least 13,623,700 are now considered recovered while at least 774,832 people have died since the outbreak emerged in China last December, according to a tally from official sources compiled by AFP at 1100 GMT on Tuesday.

item.title: Nurse, who was just passing by, helps homeless woman give birth in Makati City
item.description: For a homeless woman, her hero was a nurse, who was just walking along a street in Makati City, according to a Saksi report on Tuesday.

item.title: Inang hinahanap ang ipinaampon na anak, at anak na hinahanap ang tunay na ina, magkita na kaya?
item.description: Wala raw kamalay-malay si Ella na ipinaampon ng kaniyang kapatid na si Celsa ang kaniyang siyam na buwan gulang noon na anak niyang si Carla. Pagkaraan ng mahigit 30 taon, isang babae ang lumitaw na ipinaampon daw noon at hinahanap ang kaniyang tunay na ina. Siya na nga kaya ang anak na matagal nang hinahanap ni Ella?

item.title: WATCH: Sangkaterbang higad, naglipana sa loob ng bahay
item.description: Karaniwan daw na naglalabasan ang mga higad tuwing tag-ulan na nagiging paruparo kinalaunan.

item.title: Mauritius arrests captain of Japanese oil spill ship
item.description: Mauritius has arrested the captain of a Japanese bulk carrier that ran aground off its coast, causing a devastating oil spill in one of the world's most pristine maritime environments, police said on Tuesday.

item.title: Teacher fears military presence in Lumad school in Surigao del Sur
item.description: “July 11, dumating yong mas maraming tropa. Sila ang nagpo-pondo ngayon, nag-e-encamp sa community. Yon ang dahilan kung bakit natatakot ang mga tao, lalo na hinahanap yong leaders sa community, hinahanap yong teachers, tinatakot na wag suportahan yong mga eskwelahan ng mga Lumad dahil babansagan din silang mga terorista,” the teacher said.

item.title: US Senate committee concludes Russia used Manafort, WikiLeaks to boost Trump in 2016
item.description: Russia used Republican political operative Paul Manafort, the WikiLeaks website and others to try to influence the 2016 US presidential election to help now-US President Donald Trump's campaign, a Senate intelligence panel report said on Tuesday.

item.title: Nagpapanggap na babae sa dating app, kinikikilan ang biktimang lalaki na gagawa ng kalaswaan online
item.description: Isang lalaki na nagpapanggap na magandang babae sa dating app ang inaresto matapos ireklamo ng pangingikil ng pera sa isang lalaki na kaniyang biniktima at napapayag na gumawa ng kalaswaan online.

item.title: Japan voices concerns over Chinese activity around disputed islands -report
item.description: Japanese Defence Minister Taro Kono told China's ambassador to Japan, Kong Xuanyou, his country should refrain from activities around the disputed East China Sea islands that are controlled by Tokyo but claimed by Beijing, public broadcaster NHK reported.

item.title: COVID-19 cases in Americas reach 11.5 million, deaths 400,000 - WHO director
item.description: Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases in the Americas have reached almost 11.5 million and over 400,000 people have died as a result of the pandemic, the World Health Organization (WHO) regional director Carissa Etienne said on Tuesday.

item.title: UN tribunal convicts main Hezbollah defendant in Hariri assassination case
item.description: A UN-backed tribunal on Tuesday convicted a member of Iran-backed Hezbollah of conspiring to kill former Lebanese Prime Minister Rafik al-Hariri in a 2005 bombing that set the stage for years of confrontation between Lebanon's political forces.

item.title: COA exec bucks PhilHealth's refusal to submit documents for audit
item.description: Senator Migz Zubiri said he is quite convinced that a mafia is indeed protecting something from being uncovered. "Mapapamura ka ng pucha, magagalit ka talagang pu@#&* talaga dahil sa nangyayaring ito, pera ng taong bayan ito, para sa mahihirap," he said.

item.title: Over 600 attacks on health workers since February in connection with COVID-19, says ICRC
item.description: More than 600 attacks on health workers have been reported in connection with the COVID-19 crisis, the Red Cross warned Tuesday, urging countries to rein in the misinformation fueling the violence.
